item.title: KilledZombie Npc Handler Crashes Client!
item.dc:creator: @djzone djzone
item.description:
@djzone wrote:

JavaLearner:

And what line numbers are these?

private void killedZombies(int i) { final Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[npcs[i].spawnedBy]; 2315 --> c2.zombiesKilled++; System.out.println("To kill: " + c2.zombiesToKill + " killed: " + c2.zombiesKilled); if (c2.zombiesKilled == c2.zombiesToKill) { //c2.sendMessage("STARTING EVENT"); c2.waveId++; CycleEventHandler.getSingleton().addEvent(c2, new CycleEvent() { @Override public void execute(CycleEventContainer c) { if (c2 != null) { Server.zombieCaves.spawnNextWave(c2); } c.stop();

if (npcs.isDead == true) { if (npcs.actionTimer == 0 && npcs.applyDead == false && npcs.needRespawn == false) { npcs.updateRequired = true; npcs.facePlayer(0); npcs.killedBy = getNpcKillerId(i); npcs.animNumber = getDeadEmote(i); // dead emote npcs.animUpdateRequired = true; npcs.freezeTimer = 0; npcs.applyDead = true; killedBarrow(i); if (isZombieCaveNpc(i)) 2147 --> killedZombies(i); if (isFightCaveNpc(i)) killedTzhaar(i); if(npcs.summon == true) npcs.summon = false; npcs.actionTimer = 4; // delete time resetPlayersInCombat(i); /*if (npcs.npcType == 1158){ handleKalpite(i); }*/
